original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba'i gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba'i gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Since the basis of the view is not established, it is not tenable to view the world as finite,

original: mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mtha' med pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba mi 'thad do //
translated: or as infinite.

original: de ltar sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba rnams re re nas mi 'thad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba rnams re re nas mi 'thad par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that each of the views that depend on the prior limit and the posterior limit is untenable,🔽now, in order to show that the views that depend on both limits are untenable, it is said:

original: da ni lta ba thams cad spyir dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lta ba thams cad spyir dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the refutation of all views in general,

original: da ni don dam par lta ba thams cad spyir mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: da ni don dam par lta ba thams cad spyir mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: Now, in order to teach that ultimately all views in general are untenable, this is explained:

original: yang na dngos po thams cad dag / stong phyir rtag la sogs lta ba //
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad dag / stong phyir rtag la sogs lta ba //
translated: Or else, since all things are pure, the views of permanence, etc.,

original: gang du gang la gang dag ni //
analyzed: gang du gang la gang dag ni //
translated: Where, with regard to what, and which,

original: ci phyir kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci phyir kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Why would they ever occur?

original: yang na don dam par dngos po thams cad stong pa'i phyir rtag pa la sogs par lta ba dag gang du gang la gang dag ci'i phyir kun du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par dngos po thams cad stong pa'i phyir rtag pa la sogs par lta ba dag gang du gang la gang dag ci'i phyir kun du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, since ultimately all things are empty, where, with regard to what, and which views of permanence, etc., would they ever occur and why?🔽Because the object, the agent, the view, and the cause are unarisen.

original: yul dang byed pa po dang lta ba dang / rgyu dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yul dang byed pa po dang lta ba dang / rgyu dag ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: gang du gang dag ci'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / yul byed pa po dang lta ba dang / rgyu zhes bya ba dag go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽de'i @328a * //
analyzed: gang du gang dag ci'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / yul byed pa po dang lta ba dang / rgyu zhes bya ba dag go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽de'i @328a * //
translated: Where, with regard to what, and why should be applied respectively to the object, the agent, the view, and the cause.

original: phyir don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phyir don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In response to that, it was said, “The five appropriated aggregates definitely exist by their own intrinsic reality ultimately,

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: because they are the basis of views.” The meaning of that reason is not established,

original: don dam par lta ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par lta ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been shown that views are untenable ultimately.

original: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i sgrub pa sun dbyung bas /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i gtan tshigs yin par rtog na ni don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i sgrub pa sun dbyung bas /
translated: If you imagine that the reason is conventional, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion of the refutation of the distinctions of the opponents’ position that is incompatible with emptiness.

original: de ltar lta ba thams cad mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba thams cad mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since all views are untenable in that way,

original: pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por bsgrub pa de skad smras pa de'i gtan tshigs don dam par ni mi 'grub la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por bsgrub pa de skad smras pa de'i gtan tshigs don dam par ni mi 'grub la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: the reason that the opponents stated at the beginning of this chapter is not established ultimately, and it is contradictory conventionally.

original: da ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis de ltar bstan bcos brtsams pa mdzad pa mthar phyin nas /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis de ltar bstan bcos brtsams pa mdzad pa mthar phyin nas /
translated: Now, having completed the composition of the treatise, the Master,

original: bsgrub pa'i mchod pa de nyid sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i mchod pa de nyid sngon du btang ste /
translated: having first performed the practice offering,

original: ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba nyid smos nas phyag 'tshal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba nyid smos nas phyag 'tshal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the homage by stating the greatness of the Teacher, the Blessed Buddha,🔽he says,

original: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu rtog pa las byung ba'i lta ba dag ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi sa bon yin par thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu rtog pa las byung ba'i lta ba dag ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi sa bon yin par thugs su chud nas /
translated: Thus, having understood that views arising from conceptualization in the unreal relative are the seeds of various sufferings,

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag gi rtsa lag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag gi rtsa lag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the Blessed Buddha, the kinsman of all beings,

original: gang gis thugs brtse nyer bzung nas //
analyzed: gang gis thugs brtse nyer bzung nas //
translated: who, out of compassion,

original: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to abandon all views,

original: dam pa'i chos ni bstan mdzad pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni bstan mdzad pa //
translated: taught the sublime Dharma,

original: goo ta ma de la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: goo ta ma de la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: to that Gautama I pay homage.

original: de dag gi tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of those words,🔽he says,

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By whom,

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag gi rtsa lag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag gi rtsa lag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: The Lord Buddha is the kinsman of all beings.

original: thugs brtse nyer bzung nas /
analyzed: thugs brtse nyer bzung nas /
translated: He has taken pity on us,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: He is not teaching the Dharma for the sake of gain, honor, or fame,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni dam pa'i chos dkon mchog / shin tu rmad du byung ba bla na med pa rab tu ston par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni dam pa'i chos dkon mchog / shin tu rmad du byung ba bla na med pa rab tu ston par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Lord Buddha is teaching the most excellent, sublime, and unsurpassed Dharma Jewel.

original: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon all views,

original: zhes bya ba ni lta ba thams cad stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lta ba thams cad stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he teaches emptiness in order to abandon all views.

original: dam pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni de dam pa yang yin chos kyang yin pas dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni de dam pa yang yin chos kyang yin pas dam pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is sublime and it is the Dharma, thus it is the sublime Dharma.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i me zhi bar gyur ba'i phyir dang / yon tan rab kyi mthar phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dam pa ste bzang ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i me zhi bar gyur ba'i phyir dang / yon tan rab kyi mthar phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dam pa ste bzang ba'o //
translated: “Sublime” means good, because the fire of the afflictions together with their traces has been extinguished, and because it is the cause of the perfection of all good qualities.

original: chos zhes bya ba @328b ni gzhan dag legs pa la 'dzin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba @328b ni gzhan dag legs pa la 'dzin par byed pa'am /
translated: “Dharma” means that which holds one back from evil,

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lor 'khyam pa las 'dzin par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lor 'khyam pa las 'dzin par byed pa 'am /
translated: or that which holds one back from wandering in the cycle of saṃsāra,

original: rtog par byed pa'i rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa bla na med pa'i mthu 'dzin pa'i phyir chos so //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa'i rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa bla na med pa'i mthu 'dzin pa'i phyir chos so //
translated: or that which holds the power of the highest perfection of one’s own and others’ aims.

original: dam pa'i chos ni bzang po'i chos te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni bzang po'i chos te /
translated: The sublime Dharma is the good Dharma,

original: theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: and it is the Great Vehicle.🔽Thus, in the Sūtra on the Lion’s Roar of Queen Śrīmālā,

analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa lha mo dpal phreng gi seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
translated: it says:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba zhes bgyi ba ni theg pa chen po'i tshig gi bla dgas lags te /
translated: Blessed One, the term “upholding the holy Dharma” refers to the Mahāyāna.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad ni theg pa chen pos rab tu phye ba lags pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad ni theg pa chen pos rab tu phye ba lags pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Blessed One, all the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and all the mundane and supramundane virtuous dharmas, are distinguished by the Mahāyāna.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper bgyi na chu bo chen po bzhi ni mtsho ma dros pas rab tu phye ba lags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper bgyi na chu bo chen po bzhi ni mtsho ma dros pas rab tu phye ba lags pa de bzhin du /
translated: for example, the four great rivers are distinguished by Lake Anavatapta.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyang theg pa chen pos rab tu phye ba lags so zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyang theg pa chen pos rab tu phye ba lags so zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, all the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and all the mundane and supramundane virtuous dharmas, are distinguished by the Mahāyāna.

original: bstan mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni bstan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bstan mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni bstan par gyur pa'o //
translated: “The teaching” is what is taught.

original: goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Gautama” is the family name.

original: gdung goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdung goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because he is of the Gautama family line.

original: de la sgrub pa'i mchod pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i mchod pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: There, having first performed the worship of practice,

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: he says, “I pay homage.”

original: dpal phreng gi seng ge'i sgra'i mdo sde'i don ni /
analyzed: dpal phreng gi seng ge'i sgra'i mdo sde'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the Lion’s Roar of Queen Śrīmālā

original: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po las sangs rgyas nyid 'byung zhing sangs rgyas nyid kyis mos pa la gzigs nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir theg pa chen po las sangs rgyas nyid 'byung zhing sangs rgyas nyid kyis mos pa la gzigs nas /
translated: is as follows: Because buddhahood arises from the Mahāyāna, and because the Buddha, seeing the inclinations of beings,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bka' stsal pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bka' stsal pa de'i phyir /
translated: taught the vehicles of the hearers and solitary realizers,

original: theg pa chen po nyid dam pa'i chos zhes bya ba dngos yin par bstan to /🔽// / bam po brgyad cu pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po nyid dam pa'i chos zhes bya ba dngos yin par bstan to / // / bam po brgyad cu pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: the Mahāyāna itself is the true Dharma.

original: da ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis lung las chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos nyid kyang spang bar bya na /
analyzed: da ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis lung las chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos nyid kyang spang bar bya na /
translated: Now the author of the commentary himself teaches that the Dharma is also to be abandoned by those who understand the Dharma from the scriptures to be like a raft.

original: chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'i tshul nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa 'dir don dam pa'i de kho na bstan pa dag rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grags pa sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba'i ched du
analyzed: chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'i tshul nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa 'dir don dam pa'i de kho na bstan pa dag rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grags pa sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba'i ched du
translated: In this treatise, the body of the treatise is presented in order to establish the ultimate thatness and to refute the positions of our own and other schools.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan bcos kyi lus mtha' dag rdzogs par byas shing don dam pa'i de kho na @329a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan bcos kyi lus mtha' dag rdzogs par byas shing don dam pa'i de kho na @329a * //
translated: The clarifications of inference and thatness are completed in the body of the treatise. The ultimate thatness

original: bstan pa dag rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs la grub par gyur pas de dag sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na de dag kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: bstan pa dag rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs la grub par gyur pas de dag sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na de dag kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa ston to //
translated: is established in our own and other schools. Therefore, the clarifications of inference that establish them and those thatnesses are shown to establish the ultimate naturelessness.

original: de'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the opponent’s position,🔽it is said:

original: de ltar dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan kyang /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan kyang /
translated: Although the essencelessness of all things is taught,

original: smra ba ngan pa dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pa rab rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba lta bu dag rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /🔽phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: smra ba ngan pa dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pa rab rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba lta bu dag rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i phyir / phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The bad logicians, whose minds are impaired by the latent potentialities of their adherence to the inherent existence of things, like those with diseased vision who see such false things as falling hairs, put forth counterarguments in order to establish their own position.

original: de'i phyir phyir zlog par byed pa de dag na re 'di skad ces 'di la khyed kyis sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba'i tshad ma dag gis nye bar brtags nas rang gi phyogs grub par bstan pa de la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyir zlog par byed pa de dag na re 'di skad ces 'di la khyed kyis sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba'i tshad ma dag gis nye bar brtags nas rang gi phyogs grub par bstan pa de la /
translated: Therefore, those who put forth counterarguments say this: “In this regard, you have taught the establishment of your own position through the valid cognitions of proof and refutation, having examined it.

original: gal te sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na ni de dag la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na rtog pa'i mthu nyid med de /
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na ni de dag la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na rtog pa'i mthu nyid med de /
translated: But if the valid cognitions of proof and refutation are themselves essenceless, then they cannot have the power to conceive the way things really are, which is what you want to conceive them to be,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are essenceless.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: For example, it is like the view of the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: 'dis ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la khyed dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sun dbyung bar bya ba'i don dag sgrub pa dang / sum 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag la rag las shing tshad ma gtso bo yin par mthong ba tshad ma la gus pa bskyed nas /🔽bsgrub par bya ba dang sun dbyung bar bya ba'i don dag sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag gis nye bar brtags nas rang gi phyogs grub par bstan pa de la gal te khyed kyi sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid
analyzed: 'dis ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la khyed dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sun dbyung bar bya ba'i don dag sgrub pa dang / sum 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag la rag las shing tshad ma gtso bo yin par mthong ba tshad ma la gus pa bskyed nas / bsgrub par bya ba dang sun dbyung bar bya ba'i don dag sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag gis nye bar brtags nas rang gi phyogs grub par bstan pa de la gal te khyed kyi sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid
translated: This is because the opponents say, “You Followers of the Middle Way see that the establishment and refutation of objects of affirmation and refutation in this treatise of the Middle Way depend on valid cognition, and that valid cognition is primary. You therefore develop respect for valid cognition.

original: med pa yin na ni de dag la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med de /
analyzed: med pa yin na ni de dag la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med de /
translated: You then teach that your position is established by the valid cognitions that affirm and refute objects of affirmation and refutation. If your valid cognitions of affirmation and refutation are not established by their very essence, they do not have the power to realize the suchness of things that you wish to investigate.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: Because they have no intrinsic reality, just as, for example, the reality of things that are objects of investigation is not yet understood by those who have no power to understand it, such as the son of a barren woman.

original: de dag ni chos can dang ; bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang ; bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because the son of a barren woman has no intrinsic reality, those who have no power to understand the reality of things that are objects of investigation do not yet understand it.

original: gal te sgrub @329b pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub @329b pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
translated: If the valid cognitions of proof and refutation have no intrinsic reality,

original: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de dag la yang brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de dag la yang brtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dung ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since they are also essenceless, those who wish to analyze them do not have the power to understand the reality of things that they have not yet understood.

original: 'on te de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na ni de dag bzhin du dngos po thams cad grub pas bstan bcos mtha' dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na
analyzed: 'on te de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na ni de dag bzhin du dngos po thams cad grub pas bstan bcos mtha' dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na
translated: But if they do exist inherently, then, since all things would be established in the same way, the inferences taught in the entire treatise would be indeterminate.🔽This is what the opponent says.

original: re 'on te khyed dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na ni ji ltar tshad ma de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid yod par 'grub pas /
analyzed: re 'on te khyed dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na ni ji ltar tshad ma de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid yod par 'grub pas /
translated: But if you Madhyamikas say that those valid cognitions that establish and refute exist inherently, then just as those valid cognitions exist inherently, all things would be established as existing inherently.

original: khyed dbu ma pas bstan bcos 'di'i lus mtha' dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas bstan bcos 'di'i lus mtha' dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: Therefore, the inferences taught in the entire body of this treatise would be indeterminate.

original: de ltar khyed kyi tshad ma de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pas /🔽des na ji re zhig tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid yod pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyi tshad ma de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pas / des na ji re zhig tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid yod pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: In that case, your valid cognitions would have intrinsic reality.🔽So, are all things like your valid cognitions that have intrinsic reality?

original: 'on te khyed kyi tshad ma dag gis dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bsgrubs pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'on te khyed kyi tshad ma dag gis dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bsgrubs pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Or, just as your valid cognitions establish that all things lack intrinsic reality, are you not certain that all things lack intrinsic reality?

original: kyang gi sgras ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa yang bsdus te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa yang bsdus te /
translated: The word “also” includes the argument that there is no contradiction and no error.

original: 'di ltar khyed la tshad ma dag yod pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med par ston pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed la tshad ma dag yod pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med par ston pa bzhin du /
translated: In this way, just as you have valid cognitions that demonstrate that all things lack intrinsic reality,

original: kho bo cag la yang khyed kyi tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid yod pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ston pa'i 'thad pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag la yang khyed kyi tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid yod pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ston pa'i 'thad pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: For us, there is a reason that shows that all things exist inherently, just as your valid cognitions do.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says here:

original: de la 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: de la 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: In that regard, here, etc. What is the meaning of the reason that you state, “because they do not exist inherently”?

original: ci rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin nam /
translated: Is it an independent inference?

original: 'on te gzhan sun 'byin pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan sun 'byin pa yin /
translated: Or is it a refutation of others?

original: de la gal te rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: If it is an independent inference,

original: pha rol po dag nyid tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni rang la ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: pha rol po dag nyid tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med par sgrub na ni rang la ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: then it is not established for you because you yourself are proving that all things, such as valid cognitions, do not exist inherently.

original: 'on te gzhan sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: If it is a refutation of others,🔽then it is not established for us.

original: dbu ma pa la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du thal bar skyon 'dogs pa yin na ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin par ston to //🔽de la re zhig pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i @330a * //
analyzed: dbu ma pa la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du thal bar skyon 'dogs pa yin na ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin par ston to // de la re zhig pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i @330a * //
translated: If you charge that the fault of the consequence that all things such as valid cognitions are realityless applies to the Madhyamikas, then you are showing that it is not established for the other party.

original: phyir zhes bya ba de rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin na rang la ma grub pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba de rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin na rang la ma grub pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, first, if the reason “because of realitylessness” is an independent inference, then in order to show that it is not established for oneself,

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyi don ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin par 'dod na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyi don ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin par 'dod na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: if you accept that the meaning of the reason is “because of nonexistence,” then you are saying that the meaning of the reason is not established for yourself.

original: gal te pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de pha rol po dag rang gi phyogs nyid la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de pha rol po dag rang gi phyogs nyid la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba
translated: If the opponent asserts that the reason “because of the absence of intrinsic reality” is not established for them, because all things such as valid cognitions are absent in their own position,

original: yin par 'dod na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: yin par 'dod na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: then the meaning of the reason is not established for them.

original: 'di ltar pha rol po dag gi phyogs la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol po dag gi phyogs la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the absence of intrinsic reality of all things such as valid cognitions is not established for the opponent’s position.

original: ji ste pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gzhan sun 'byin pa yin na ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gzhan sun 'byin pa yin na ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the reason “because of the absence of intrinsic reality” is a refutation of others, then to show that it is not established for others,

original: ji ste gzhan yin na ni gzhan la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan yin na ni gzhan la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “If it is other, it is for others.”

original: ji ste pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa gzhan sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa gzhan sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the reason “because of nonentityness” is a refutation of the opponent’s position, it is not autonomous inference.

original: dbu ma pa la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid du thal bar skyon 'dogs pa yin na ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa la tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid du thal bar skyon 'dogs pa yin na ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you charge that the fault of the consequence that all things, such as valid cognitions, are essentially natureless applies to the Madhyamaka, then it is not established for the other party,

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pa ni tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad gtan ngo bo nyid med pa mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa lta bur mi 'dod kyi tha snyad du rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa sgyu ma la sogs🔽pa lta bur yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pa ni tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad gtan ngo bo nyid med pa mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa lta bur mi 'dod kyi tha snyad du rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa sgyu ma la sogs🔽pa lta bur yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we Madhyamikas do not assert that all things, such as valid cognitions, are utterly natureless, like the son of a barren woman, and so on, but rather that they exist conventionally, like illusions, as produced by causes and conditions.

original: des na kho bo cag gi phyogs la tha snyad du bsgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa bzhin du gtan ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: des na kho bo cag gi phyogs la tha snyad du bsgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag mo gsham gyi bu'i lta ba la sogs pa bzhin du gtan ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore, in our own system, the valid cognitions that affirm and that negate do exist conventionally, unlike the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: de dag la rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dud ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na da dud ma rtogs pa dag rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do have the power to realize the reality of things that are asserted to be permanent.

original: da ni pha rol po dag gis gal te sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag gis gal te sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin na ni /
translated: Now, if you opponents say that if the valid cognitions that affirm and that negate do not lack entityness,

original: de dag rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med de zhes smras pa de don dam par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i de kho na rtogs pa'i mthu nyid med de zhes smras pa de don dam par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
translated: then it is not the case that they do not have the power to realize the reality of things that are asserted to be permanent, then if you affirm that in an ultimate sense, you are proving that which is already established for us.

original: tha snyad du sgrub na ni khas blangs pas gnod pa yin par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du sgrub na ni khas blangs pas gnod pa yin par bstan par bya ste /
translated: If you affirm it in a conventional sense, then you are undermined by your own assertions.🔽To show that if you affirm it in an ultimate sense, you are proving that which is already established for us, the text says:

original: de la re zhig don dam par sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If you affirm that in an ultimate sense, you are proving that which is already established for us.

original: don dam par tshad ma la @330b sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pas mthu nyid sel bar byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par tshad ma la @330b sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pas mthu nyid sel bar byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you are refuting the power of valid cognition, etc. ultimately, since they are essenceless, then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa la yang de ltar grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa la yang de ltar grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For us, Madhyamikas, this is already established.

original: tha snyad du grub na khas blangs pas gnod par bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad du na ni khas blangs pas gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad du grub na khas blangs pas gnod par bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad du na ni khas blangs pas gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to show that if they are established conventionally, they are undermined by our own assertions, he says, They are undermined by our own assertions conventionally.

original: khyod kyis kyang tha snyad du tshad ma la sogs pa yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang tha snyad du tshad ma la sogs pa yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For you also assert that valid cognition, etc. exist conventionally.

original: de ltar smra ba ngan pa dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pa rab rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba lta bu dag rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar smra ba ngan pa dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pa rab rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba lta bu dag rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, those who propound this bad doctrine, whose minds are impaired by the latent potential for the conception of things as having essences, like those with diseased vision who see false appearances, refute us in order to establish their own position.

original: phyir zlog par byed pa de dag gi glan ka skabs med par byas nas /
analyzed: phyir zlog par byed pa de dag gi glan ka skabs med par byas nas /
translated: We have shown that they have no opportunity to refute us.

original: da ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa don dam par tshad ma rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa don dam par tshad ma rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, the author of the commentary himself, in order to demonstrate that ultimately the valid cognitions are essenceless,

original: don dam par tshad ma rnams la yang rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa dang / yid ches par bya ba ston pa'i mthu nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par tshad ma rnams la yang rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa dang / yid ches par bya ba ston pa'i mthu nyid med de /
translated: says, “Ultimately, the valid cognitions do not have the power to realize the object of knowledge or to teach it to others,

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because they are compounded, like a clod of earth.”

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na bong ba ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul yid ches par bya ba ston pa'i mthu nyid med pa de bzhin du tshad ma rnams kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir de rnams la yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa dang /🔽rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul yid ches par bya ba ston pa'i mthu nyid med do //
analyzed: dper na bong ba ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul yid ches par bya ba ston pa'i mthu nyid med pa de bzhin du tshad ma rnams kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir de rnams la yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul yid ches par bya ba ston pa'i mthu nyid med do //
translated: Likewise, because valid knowledge is a product, it also lacks the power to realize the object of direct perception and to reveal the object of inferential valid knowledge.

original: de bzhin du skye ba can nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid dang / 'jig pa nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba can nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid dang / 'jig pa nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should state extensively the inference that has the reason of being produced, being different due to the division of conditions, being perishable, being an object of knowledge, being an object of expression, and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis spyir skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / bya ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis spyir skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / bya ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar te /
translated: “Because arising is in general refuted by the previous explanations and because activity is refuted” should be applied to the previous thesis and its reason.

original: de dag gis don dam par tshad ma rnams ngo bo nyid med pas mthu nyid med par rjes su dpag par bya ste /🔽de yang sngar skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa la sogs par bstan pa'i tshul gyis spyir @331a * //
analyzed: de dag gis don dam par tshad ma rnams ngo bo nyid med pas mthu nyid med par rjes su dpag par bya ste / de yang sngar skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa la sogs par bstan pa'i tshul gyis spyir @331a * //
translated: By these, one should infer that ultimately valid cognitions are powerless because they lack intrinsic reality.

original: tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba dang bya ba bgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyi skye ba dang bya ba bgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because the arising and activity of all things such as valid cognitions are refuted in general by the method explained in the chapter on nonarising and so on,🔽ultimately valid cognitions are powerless because they lack intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan yang gal te tshad ma rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na des na ngo bo nyid ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir gzhal bya med cing gzhal bya mi 'jal bar yang rang nyid kyi tshad mar 'gyur ba dang gzhal bya yang tshad ma med cing tshad
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te tshad ma rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na des na ngo bo nyid ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir gzhal bya med cing gzhal bya mi 'jal bar yang rang nyid kyi tshad mar 'gyur ba dang gzhal bya yang tshad ma med cing tshad
translated: Moreover, if valid cognitions existed intrinsically, then because intrinsic reality does not depend on anything else, they would be valid cognitions by themselves without objects of comprehension and without comprehending objects of comprehension. And objects of comprehension would be objects of comprehension without valid cognitions and without being comprehended by valid cognitions.

original: mas yongs su ma gzhal bar yang rang nyid kyis gzhal byar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: mas yongs su ma gzhal bar yang rang nyid kyis gzhal byar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de ltar tshad ma yang gzhal bya 'jal na tshad ma yin gyi mi 'jal na ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma yang gzhal bya 'jal na tshad ma yin gyi mi 'jal na ma yin la /
translated: Thus, if a valid cognition measures the object of comprehension, it is a valid cognition. If it does not measure it, it is not.

original: gzhal bya yang tshad mas gzhal na gzhal bya yin gyi ma gzhal na ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhal bya yang tshad mas gzhal na gzhal bya yin gyi ma gzhal na ma yin pas /
translated: And if the object of comprehension is measured by a valid cognition, it is an object of comprehension. If it is not measured, it is not.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma dang gzhan bya gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid nges par gnas pa ma yin gyi brjod pa khyad par can rten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma dang gzhan bya gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid nges par gnas pa ma yin gyi brjod pa khyad par can rten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the definitions of both valid cognition and object of comprehension are not ascertained. They are merely special expressions that depend on one another. Therefore, ultimately they are essenceless.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni tshad ma rnams spyir dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni tshad ma rnams spyir dgag pa bstan to //
translated: Thus far the refutation of valid cognition in general has been presented.

original: da ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang bsgrub pa'i yan lag rnams re re nas khyad par las dgag pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang bsgrub pa'i yan lag rnams re re nas khyad par las dgag pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now the refutation of direct perception, inference, and the branches of the proof will be presented individually.

original: de'i phyir / khyad par las dpag par bya ba ni don dam par mngon sum la mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyad par las dpag par bya ba ni don dam par mngon sum la mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: it is to be inferred from the specific that in the ultimate sense, perception does not have the nature of perception,

original: dbang po la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is based on the sense faculties.

original: dper na 'khrul pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dper na 'khrul pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: For example, like a mistaken consciousness.

original: 'di ni mngon sum dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This shows the inference that refutes perception.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni dbang po la brten pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni dbang po la brten pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a mistaken consciousness does not have the nature of perception because it is based on the sense faculties.

original: mngon sum yang dbang po la brten pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: mngon sum yang dbang po la brten pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: In the same way, perception also does not have the nature of perception because it is based on the sense faculties.

original: de bzhin du don dam par rjes su dpag pa la yang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par rjes su dpag pa la yang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In the same way, in the ultimate sense, inference also does not have the nature of inference,🔽because it is based on the sense faculties.

original: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: The statement “because it is a valid cognition, like direct perception” presents an inference that refutes an inference.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na mngon sum ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de la rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de la yang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma de
analyzed: dper na mngon sum ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de la rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de la yang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma de
translated: For example, just as direct perception is a valid cognition, it does not have the nature of inference. In the same way, because inference is a valid cognition, it also does not have the nature of inference.

original: la med do //
analyzed: la med do //
translated: The valid cognition of inference does not exist in inference.

original: yang na don dam par rjes su dpag pa @331b ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par rjes su dpag pa @331b ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Or, inference is not a valid cognition in an ultimate sense.

original: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a conception,🔽like the cognition that a stump is a person.

original: dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This presents an inference that refutes the claim that inference is a valid cognition.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te ;
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te ;
translated: Moreover, they are respectively applied to the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes, and the example.

original: dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the cognition of a stump as a man is not a valid cognition because it is a conception.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, inference is not a valid cognition because it is a conception.

original: da ni dam bcas pa de la sogs pa sgrub pa'i yan lag rnams mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa de la sogs pa sgrub pa'i yan lag rnams mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the parts of the proof such as the thesis are untenable, he says,

original: de bzhin du dam bcas pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dam bcas pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras to //
translated: Likewise, the parts of the proof such as the thesis, etc.

original: de la re zhig dam bcas pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bcas pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: With regard to that, in order to demonstrate that the thesis is untenable, he says,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ji bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ji bstan par bya ste /
translated: The definition of that should be taught.

original: de'i phyir / de dag gis bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni bsgrub par bya ba nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag gis bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni bsgrub par bya ba nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the demonstration of what is to be proven is the ascertainment of the thesis.

original: bsgrub par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs don 'gal ba la sogs pas ma bsal ba gang yin pa ni dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsgrub par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs don 'gal ba la sogs pas ma bsal ba gang yin pa ni dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The definition of thesis is that which is asserted to be established by one who wishes to establish it, and is not refuted by contradiction of the meaning and so on.

original: des ni dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //🔽rigs pa'i bstan bcos las dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul yin par 'byung bas de la bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i tshul gsum po bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang
analyzed: des ni dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to // rigs pa'i bstan bcos las dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul yin par 'byung bas de la bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i tshul gsum po bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang
translated: This explains the definition of thesis.🔽Since the definition of thesis in the treatise on logic is that it is a mode of ascertaining the existence of the object to be established, then among the three modes of teaching the object to be established, the mode of ascertaining the existence of the object to be established,

original: / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gsum las bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul yin te /
analyzed: / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gsum las bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul yin te /
translated: the mode of ascertaining the existence of similar instances, and the mode of ascertaining the nonexistence of dissimilar instances, it is the mode of ascertaining the existence of the object to be established.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba nges par bzung ba ste zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba nges par bzung ba ste zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase “the existence of the object to be established is ascertained.”

original: de ji ltar yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul yin zhe na /
translated: How is the existence of the object to be established ascertained?

original: bsgrub par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs don 'gal ba la sogs pas ma bsal ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid du nges pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs don 'gal ba la sogs pas ma bsal ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid du nges pa ste /
translated: The existence of the object to be established is ascertained when the proponent of the argument has not eliminated the subject that he wishes to establish as the property-possessor of the property he wishes to prove by means of a reason that is one of the three modes.🔽The subject of the inference is the subject that is the property-possessor of the property to be proven. The property to be proven is the property that the proponent of the argument wishes to prove. The reason is one of the three modes: nature, nonobservation, or effect.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba chos yod pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rtags gsum po ngo bo nyid dang / mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu zhes bya ba dag gis ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa dang /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba chos yod pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rtags gsum po ngo bo nyid dang / mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu zhes bya ba dag gis ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa dang /
translated: The inference of impermanence from nature is as follows.

original: mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu @332a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu @332a * //
translated: The inference of nonexistence from nonobservation is as follows.

original: las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba dang / ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa la sogs pa'i skyon dag gis ma bsal ba gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul zhes bya ste de ni dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba dang / ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa la sogs pa'i skyon dag gis ma bsal ba gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul zhes bya ste de ni dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the reason that infers the effect or cause is not refuted by faults such as contradiction, nonestablishment, or inconclusiveness, and it is called “the mode of ascertaining the presence of the probandum.”

original: de la gang dag sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa dag don dam pa pa yin pa smras pa de dag la 'di skad ces dri ba bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa dag don dam pa pa yin pa smras pa de dag la 'di skad ces dri ba bya ste /
translated: Those who say that proofs and refutations are ultimate should be asked:

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin /
translated: “What is the probandum?”🔽“Is it established or not?”

original: grub pa 'am 'on te ma grub pa yin zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas rigs pa can la sogs pa gang dag sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag don dam pa pa yin par smra ba de dag la 'di skad ces sgrub par 'dod pa'i
analyzed: grub pa 'am 'on te ma grub pa yin zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas rigs pa can la sogs pa gang dag sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma dag don dam pa pa yin par smra ba de dag la 'di skad ces sgrub par 'dod pa'i
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way would say this to the Enumerators and others who say that the valid cognition of proofs and refutations is ultimate.

original: rtags gsum po ngo bo nyid dang mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba dag gis rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba chos mi rtag pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rgyu dang zhes bya ba dag bsgrub par bya'o zhes rigs pa'i bstan bcos las byung na bsgrub par bya ba de gang yin /
analyzed: rtags gsum po ngo bo nyid dang mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba dag gis rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba chos mi rtag pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rgyu dang zhes bya ba dag bsgrub par bya'o zhes rigs pa'i bstan bcos las byung na bsgrub par bya ba de gang yin /
translated: If that is so, what is the property of the subject to be proven?🔽The two types of analysis are presented:

original: ji ste sgrub pa'am 'on te ma grub pa yin zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: ji ste sgrub pa'am 'on te ma grub pa yin zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Is it established or not?

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the first analysis is untenable, it says:

original: de la gal te grub pa yin na ni de bsgrub pa don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la gal te grub pa yin na ni de bsgrub pa don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is established, then proving it is pointless.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba de grub pa yin na ni de sgrub pa don med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba de grub pa yin na ni de sgrub pa don med pa nyid de /
translated: If the property of the subject to be proven is established, then proving it is pointless.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would be a fault to prove what is already established.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second analysis is also untenable,🔽it says:

original: 'on te ma grub pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is not established,

original: don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: then ultimately it is not to be proven.

original: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not established,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns.

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba de ma grub pa yin na ni don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba de ma grub pa yin na ni don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If that which is to be proven is not established, then ultimately it is not to be proven.

original: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not established.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin te /
translated: Like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid ni yod pa nyid du ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid ni yod pa nyid du ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns is not to be proven because it is not established as existent.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa yang ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //🔽de ltar bsgrub par bya ba grub pa dang / ma grub pa gnyi ga sgrub pa'i chos dag gi bsgrub par bya ba ma @332b yin pas don dam par dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa yang ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no // de ltar bsgrub par bya ba grub pa dang / ma grub pa gnyi ga sgrub pa'i chos dag gi bsgrub par bya ba ma @332b yin pas don dam par dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: Because that which is not established as the object to be established is not the object to be established.🔽Thus, because neither that which is established nor that which is not established is the object to be established, the definition of a thesis is not tenable in an ultimate sense.

original: ji ste yang 'di snyam du rang dang gnyi ga la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste yang 'di snyam du rang dang gnyi ga la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: But if you think that that which is not established for oneself, for the other, or for both is not the object to be established, then the proof is for that which is already established.

original: 'on te gzhan la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin zhe na ni dpe med de ri bong gi rva med pa la grub pa'i chos med pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid yin no snyam du sems na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re khyed dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba de gal te grub pa yin na ni de sgrub pa don med pa nyid do zhes smras
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin zhe na ni dpe med de ri bong gi rva med pa la grub pa'i chos med pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid yin no snyam du sems na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re khyed dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba de gal te grub pa yin na ni de sgrub pa don med pa nyid do zhes smras
translated: But if you think that the meaning of the reason is not established because the nonexistence of a rabbit’s horns is not established, and because there is no example, since there is no property to be established that is established in regard to the nonexistence of a rabbit’s horns, then we reply:

original: pa ni bden no //
analyzed: pa ni bden no //
translated: It is true that you, the Mādhyamika, have said that if the object of affirmation is established, then the proof is pointless.

original: 'on te ma grub pa yin na ni don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa yin na ni don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not established, then it is not ultimately to be affirmed,

original: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not established.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is just like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa zhes bya ba de gal te rang dang gnyi ga la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes khyod zer na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa zhes bya ba de gal te rang dang gnyi ga la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes khyod zer na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say that that which is to be established is not established for both oneself and the other, then it is established for the established.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang bsgrub par bya ba rang dang gnyi ga la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang bsgrub par bya ba rang dang gnyi ga la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in our system it is already established that that which is to be established is not established for both oneself and the other.

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes khyed zer na ni khyed kyi dpe med de /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes khyed zer na ni khyed kyi dpe med de /
translated: But if you say that that which is to be established is not established for the other, then you have no example.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyi dpe ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyi dpe ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Because in this case your example is like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns.

original: ri bong gi rva med pa la khyed kyi sgrub pa'i chos ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med de /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med pa la khyed kyi sgrub pa'i chos ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med de /
translated: Because in the absence of a rabbit’s horns, the predicate of the probandum is not established for you.

original: ri bong gi rva'i yon po med pa nyid ni gzhan la yang grub pa yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //

translated: Because the nonexistence of the rabbit’s horns is established as existing in other things, it is not suitable to say, “Your reason is not established.”

translated: Thus, since that which is not established for another is to be established, the definition of a thesis is in terms of ultimate reality. Therefore, the valid cognitions also exist by their own intrinsic reality in the ultimate.

translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir dang / dpe la yang spyir rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ma grub pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la /

translated: Since the reason is stated in general terms, since the example is taught in general terms, and since it is also refuted that it is not established for another, it is not the case that it is established as established.

analyzed: dpe dang gtan tshigs med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi dpe ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de la yang yon po nyid yod par ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i phyogs la gtan tshigs
translated: In this way, in the example of ours, “like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns,” since crookedness does not exist, it is not established. Therefore, it is not to be proven.

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang ldan pas dpe med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate the pervasion, since the example possesses the property of the probandum, it is not that there is no example.

analyzed: dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la ma grub pa nyid kyang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bkag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not that there is no reason, because the Madhyamika refutes that which is not established for the other party to be proven.

analyzed: 'di ltar dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la ma grub pa nyid kyang ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes ma grub pa nyid yin na bsgrub par bya
translated: In this way, since the Madhyamika’s reason is not established, that is to be proven. Since that which is not established for the other party is not established, it is not to be proven.

translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no reason.🔽Thus, since the unestablished subject is not to be established, like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns, the definition of the thesis is not established as ultimate.

translated: Since the other valid cognitions are not established in the same way, since all things are not established in the same way, the inferences taught in all of our treatises are not indeterminate.

translated: then the opponent says, “It is not correct for you Mādhyamikas to say that neither of the two, the established and the not established, is the probandum, having analyzed the probandum as established and not established.

translated: For example, just as an action is performed without analyzing it as performed or not performed, and a disciple is trained without analyzing it as trained or untrained,

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa dang lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: pha rol po dag gis tshig de ni kho bos bsgrub par bya ba grub pa dang ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa de'i lan ma yin te /
translated: The opponent says, “That statement of ours is not an answer to the demonstration that what is established and what is not established are not established.”

original: 'di ltar bya ba yang gang yin ;
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba yang gang yin ;
translated: In that case, what is the action?

original: byas pa'am 'on te ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: byas pa'am 'on te ma byas pa yin /
translated: Is it done or is it not done?🔽What is the object to be tamed?

original: gdul ba gang yin btul ba'am /
analyzed: gdul ba gang yin btul ba'am /
translated: Is it tamed or is it not tamed?🔽The objection and analysis are the same as before: “What is the object to be established? Is it established or is it not established?”

original: 'on te ma btul ba yin zhes brgal zhing brtag pa yang sngar bsgrub par bya ba gang yin grub pa'i 'on te ma grub pa yin zhes bya ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / lan kyang de la gal te grub pa yin na ni de sgrub pa don med pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa yin na ni don dam par de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is not established, then ultimately it is not an object to be established.

original: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas btab zin pa'i phyir te /
translated: For example, it is like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns.

analyzed: 'dir yang gal te byas pa dang btul ba yin na ni de byed pa dang btul ba don med pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'on te ma byas pa dang ma btul ba yin na ni don dam par de bya ba dang gdul ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not made and not disciplined, then ultimately it is not to be made and disciplined,

original: ma byas pa dang ma btul ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma byas pa dang ma btul ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not made and not disciplined.

analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i yon po nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the crookedness of a rabbit’s horns.

original: gal te lan ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lan ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that this is not a response,🔽because it has the meaning of potentiality,

translated: the opponent says, “We say that the object to be accomplished is established, like making and disciplining. That is not a response,🔽because it has the meaning of potentiality.”

original: 'di ltar byas pa dang ma byas pa dang btul ba dang ma btul ba dag bya ba dang gdul ba ma yin yang byed bzhin pa dang / gdul ba bzhin pa ni nus pa'i don yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang / gdul ba yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa dang ma byas pa dang btul ba dang ma btul ba dag bya ba dang gdul ba ma yin yang byed bzhin pa dang / gdul ba bzhin pa ni nus pa'i don yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang / gdul ba yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Thus, though that which is done and that which is not done, that which is tamed and that which is not tamed are not that which is to be done and that which is to be tamed, respectively, since they are the meaning of potential, they are that which is to be done and that which is to be tamed, respectively.

original: @334a * // grub pa dang ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin yang bsgrub bzhin pa ni nus pa'i don yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: @334a * // grub pa dang ma grub pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin yang bsgrub bzhin pa ni nus pa'i don yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Though that which is accomplished and that which is not accomplished are not that which is to be accomplished, since they are the meaning of potential, they are that which is to be accomplished.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa dang lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid kyis lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the response is the same as the objection and because it has already been responded to, he says, “Because it has already been responded to.”

translated: But in response to the question, “What is it that is made or not made, tamed or not tamed, accomplished or not accomplished?”

analyzed: lan kyang snga ma bzhin pas de yang lan ma yin no //
translated: the response is the same as before, so that is not a response.

original: don dam par dam bcas ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dam bcas ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A thesis is not a proof in the ultimate.

translated: The statement, “Because the object to be proven is a thesis, the mere statement of a thesis is like a statement of a thesis to be proven” teaches that a thesis is not a proof of the object to be proven through inference.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are, respectively, the subject, the property to be proven, the proving property, and the example.

translated: For example, a thesis that is stated by someone who is not learned in the treatises of reasoning is not established by the incomplete branches of proof such as the reason and example.🔽Because the thesis is the meaning to be proven, it does not prove the meaning to be proven.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa gtan tshigs dang / dpe la sogs pa sgrub pa'i yan lag tshang ba smras pa dag gi dam bcas pa yang bstan par bya ba'i don dam bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
