translated: In the same way, the thesis of those who speak with complete branches of proof such as reasons and examples that are learned in the treatises of reasoning is also the meaning to be proven. Therefore, it does not prove the meaning to be proven.

original: don dam par gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /

translated: Here, the opponent says: A complete statement that is not distinctive and ordinary is not a property to be proven.

original: yan lag tshang ba'i tshig khyad par can rtog ge phyi mas gnod par gyur ba nyid ma yin na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: yan lag tshang ba'i tshig khyad par can rtog ge phyi mas gnod par gyur ba nyid ma yin na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary, in response to the above opponent’s position, which is drawn out from within the text, says:

original: yad lag tshang ba'i tshig khyad bar can sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid phyogs su byas pa la yang yan lag tshang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yad lag tshang ba'i tshig khyad bar can sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid phyogs su byas pa la yang yan lag tshang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: “Even if one takes the position that a complete statement with a specific predicate is not a proof, it is still a proof because it has all the parts.”

original: dper na rtog ge phyi mas gnod bar gyur pa bzhin ne zhes bkag pa kho na'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na rtog ge phyi mas gnod bar gyur pa bzhin ne zhes bkag pa kho na'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is incorrect because it is refuted by the following passage: “It is not a proof because it is undermined by subsequent reasoning, just like the example.”

original: de la yang kho bos don dam par yan lag tshang ba'i tshig khyad par can ni bsgrub pa ma yin te zhes phyogs su byas la /
analyzed: de la yang kho bos don dam par yan lag tshang ba'i tshig khyad par can ni bsgrub pa ma yin te zhes phyogs su byas la /
translated: In response to this, we would say that the opponent should take the position that “ultimately, a complete statement with a specific predicate is not a proof”

original: yan lag tshang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag tshang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and then argue that it is a proof because it has all the parts.

original: dper na rtog ge phyi mas gnod par gyur pa bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gis bkag pa kho na'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na rtog ge phyi mas gnod par gyur pa bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gis bkag pa kho na'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the later reasoning refuting the earlier reasoning.

original: de bzhin du don dam par sun 'byin pa la ni sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par sun 'byin pa la ni sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In the same way, in the ultimate, the refutation does not have the nature of a refutation,

original: tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has the nature of words.🔽For example, it is like an argument that is a pseudo-refutation.

original: dper na sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'i sgrub pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni sun 'byin pa la sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med par rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: dper na sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'i sgrub pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni sun 'byin pa la sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med par rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This shows the inference that the refutation does not have the nature of a refutation.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the property to be established, the property of the establishment, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na sun 'byin pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na ma yin pa sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'i sgrub pa la sogs pa ni tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de la sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sun 'byin pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na ma yin pa sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'i sgrub pa la sogs pa ni tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de la sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the essence of a refutation and the essence of an establishment such as a pseudo-refutation are not the essence of a refutation because they are just words.🔽

original: sun 'byin pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na yang tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na yang tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, just as the expression “refutation” and the expression “proof” are the nature of words, and the expression “that which is not reality” and the expression “that which appears to be a refutation” are the nature of words,

original: de la yang sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang sun 'byin pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: so too the expression “refutation” and “reality” are the nature of words.🔽Therefore, just as the expression “refutation” is not a refutation, so too the expression “reality” is not reality.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir de bzhin du gzhal bya yang ma grub pas gtan tshigs snga ma dag ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir de bzhin du gzhal bya yang ma grub pas gtan tshigs snga ma dag ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, since valid knowledge and so on are not established in that way, since objects of comprehension are also not established, the previous arguments are not indeterminate.

original: de ltar sgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma spyi dang khyad par dang / dam bcas pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i yan lag rnams don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir de bzhin du gzhal bya yang ma grub pas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa dang / sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma spyi dang khyad par dang / dam bcas pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i yan lag rnams don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir de bzhin du gzhal bya yang ma grub pas /
translated: Thus, because the valid cognitions that establish and refute, in general and in particular, and the branches that establish the thesis and so on are not ultimately established, the objects of apprehension are also not established in the same way.

original: de'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag na re 'on te de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na ni de @336b dag bzhin du dngos po thams cad 'grub pas bstan bcos mtha' dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag na re 'on te de dag ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na ni de @336b dag bzhin du dngos po thams cad 'grub pas bstan bcos mtha' dag tu bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no
translated: Therefore, previously, the opponent said, “If they exist by their own intrinsic reality, then all things are established in the same way, and the inferences taught in the entire treatise are also indeterminate.”

original: zhes zer ba'i tshig gi skabs med pas /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i tshig gi skabs med pas /
translated: Since there is no opportunity for such words,

original: dbu ma pas bstan bcos 'di'i lus mtha' dag tu sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs snga ma dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: dbu ma pas bstan bcos 'di'i lus mtha' dag tu sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs snga ma dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: the Followers of the Middle Way do not have any indecisive reasons in the body of this treatise.

original: pha rol po dag gi dpe rjes su dpag pa dag bzhin du dngos po thams cad 'grub pas zhes bya ba ma grub pas 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi dpe rjes su dpag pa dag bzhin du dngos po thams cad 'grub pas zhes bya ba ma grub pas 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yang med do //
translated: Since all things are established in the same way that the inferences of others are established, there is no error of contradiction, nor is there any fault of nonestablishment.🔽The above is sufficient for a brief explanation.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog go zhes bya ba ni sngar de ltar dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan kyang /
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog go zhes bya ba ni sngar de ltar dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan kyang /
translated: Although all things have been shown to be essenceless in this way,

original: smra ba ngan pa dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pa rab rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba lta bu dag rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smra ba ngan pa dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pa rab rib can gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba lta bu dag rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: those whose minds are impaired by the latent potential for the bad habit of clinging to things as having an essence, who see what is not real as real, in order to establish their own position,

original: phyir zlog par byed pa dag gi glan ka'i skabs med par bya ba dang / 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis lung las chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos nyid kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'i tshul nyid sgrub pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyi lus 'dir don dam pa'i de
analyzed: phyir zlog par byed pa dag gi glan ka'i skabs med par bya ba dang / 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis lung las chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos nyid kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'i tshul nyid sgrub pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyi lus 'dir don dam pa'i de
translated: The treatise body is presented here in order to establish the ultimate reality itself, which is taught in the scriptures, in the statement: “Those who know the Dharma to be like a raft are to abandon even the Dharma, not to speak of non-Dharma.”🔽The inferences, the refutations, and the valid cognitions that teach reality are presented here in order to establish the ultimate reality itself, which is taught in the treatise body.

original: kho na bstan pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang / sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang / de kho na dag ston pa'i tshad ma dag nye bar bzhag pa yang 'dir bstan bcos kyi lus mtha' dag rdzogs shing don dam pa'i de kho na bstan pa nyid grub nas tshad ma de dag kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i
analyzed: kho na bstan pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang / sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang / de kho na dag ston pa'i tshad ma dag nye bar bzhag pa yang 'dir bstan bcos kyi lus mtha' dag rdzogs shing don dam pa'i de kho na bstan pa nyid grub nas tshad ma de dag kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i
translated: When the treatise body is complete and the ultimate reality itself is established, these valid cognitions are also taught to be ultimately realityless.

original: skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the chapter.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol po dag gis /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol po dag gis /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows:🔽The opponent says that the refutation of the proof of the existence of external objects shows that the view of emptiness is taught.

original: bsgrub pa smras pa'i sun dbyung ba brjod pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang // tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa smras pa'i sun dbyung ba brjod pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang // tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the general conclusion of this chapter, and it is the result of valid knowledge.🔽Here, in the context of the twenty-seventh chapter, the Investigation of the View, the meaning of the chapter is the view that is the result of valid knowledge.

original: lta ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por 'di skad ces don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga
analyzed: lta ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por 'di skad ces don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga
translated: The opponent says that in the beginning of this chapter it is said that ultimately the five appropriated aggregates

original: ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: do indeed exist inherently.

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi khyad par mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par gyi sgrub ba smras pa'i sun dbyung ba dbu ma pas brjod pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin @337a * //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi khyad par mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par gyi sgrub ba smras pa'i sun dbyung ba dbu ma pas brjod pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin @337a * //
translated: In this way, the Madhyamikas respond to the objections raised by the opponents who argue that emptiness is not the correct view because it is not in accord with the characteristics of emptiness.🔽The Madhyamikas have thus demonstrated that emptiness is the correct view.

original: no ; lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: no ; lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: To demonstrate that emptiness is the correct view, the Madhyamikas also cite scriptural sources to counter the claim that the Madhyamaka is a mere treatise of dry logic.🔽To this end, the Madhyamikas cite the following passage from the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines:

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa las /
translated: Subhuti, the great bodhisattva beings who practice the perfection of wisdom should not settle down on form,

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni lta ba'i rnam pa yang ma yin la lta ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni lta ba'i rnam pa yang ma yin la lta ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, form is not the aspect of view, nor is it the abandonment of the aspect of view.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang lta ba'i rnam pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang lta ba'i rnam pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the aspect of view,

original: lta ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they the abandonment of the aspect of view.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa lta ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang ma yin pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa lta ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang ma yin pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the abandonment of the aspect of view is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar phung po lnga po dag lta ba'i yul nyid ma yin par dgag pa mdzad pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar phung po lnga po dag lta ba'i yul nyid ma yin par dgag pa mdzad pas /
translated: The Blessed One, having thus refuted the five aggregates as the object of view,

original: de'i phyir kho bos lta ba de dag dgag pa smras pa ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //🔽de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos lta ba de dag dgag pa smras pa ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do // de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: Therefore, when we state the refutation of those views, there is no contradiction with what you accept.🔽Thus, the establishment of those scriptures that inspire confidence is the quality and source of the teaching of emptiness.

original: re zhig des ni lung grub pa 'di'i yon tan yin par bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig des ni lung grub pa 'di'i yon tan yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the quality of this established scripture is that it is the source of the teaching of emptiness.

original: da ni rigs pas grub pa 'di'i yon tan yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rigs pas grub pa 'di'i yon tan yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the quality of this established reasoning is that it is the source of the teaching of emptiness, it says:🔽Similarly, the meaning of the treatise is taught to be the nonconceptual wisdom of the ultimate truth, the nectar of nonconceptual suchness endowed with the attributes of dependent origination, nonarising, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas bstan bcos kyi don rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i don dam pa ston ka'i nam mkha' dri ma
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas bstan bcos kyi don rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i don dam pa ston ka'i nam mkha' dri ma
translated: The ultimate truth is taught to be the stainless space of autumn, free from the two obscurations.

original: med pa lta bu'i yul can spros pa ma lus pa legs par nye bar zhi ba tha dad pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid dang bral ba zhi ba so so rang gis rig par bya ba bstan pa grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: med pa lta bu'i yul can spros pa ma lus pa legs par nye bar zhi ba tha dad pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid dang bral ba zhi ba so so rang gis rig par bya ba bstan pa grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The subject that is like a non-existent, the pacification of all elaborations, free from difference and sameness, the peace that is to be personally experienced, is taught.

original: bstan bcos 'di'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang ; chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang ; chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: The meaning of this treatise is dependent origination, which is free from cessation, free from arising, free from annihilation, free from permanence, free from coming, free from going, free from a different meaning,

original: don gcig pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pas don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i don dam pa ston ka'i nam mkha' dri ma @337b med pa lta bu'i yul can spros pa
analyzed: don gcig pa ma yin pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pas don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bdud rtsi'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i don dam pa ston ka'i nam mkha' dri ma @337b med pa lta bu'i yul can spros pa
translated: and free from a single meaning. By teaching the special features, the ultimate non-conceptual wisdom, the nectar of thatness, the non-conceptual ultimate, the subject that is like the stainless autumn sky, the pacification of all elaborations,🔽free from difference and sameness, the peace that is to be personally experienced, is taught.

original: thams cad nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba so so rang gis rig par bya ba bstan pa yin pas de yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba so so rang gis rig par bya ba bstan pa yin pas de yang grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it is taught that all is thoroughly pacified, peaceful, and to be realized personally, that is also established.

original: de grub pa yang lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa 'di'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de grub pa yang lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa 'di'i yon tan yin te /
translated: That establishment is a quality of this teaching of the view of emptiness.

original: des ni rigs pas 'grub pa 'di'i yon tan yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rigs pas 'grub pa 'di'i yon tan yin par bstan to //
translated: That shows that this establishment by reasoning is a quality of this teaching.

original: de ltar lung dang rigs pas grub pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lung dang rigs pas grub pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Those establishments by scripture and reasoning that are taught are the very objects to be explained in this treatise. That is also the greatness of the author and the greatness of the commentator.

original: da ni de ltar bstan bcos 'di'i don ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa yin na 'dir de kho na nyid gang yin pa mdor bstan pa ma byas par rjes su dpag pa dang sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang / de kho na bstan pa'i tham lag mang po dag gis bsgrub ci dgos snyam du sems pa rnams la de'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ltar bstan bcos 'di'i don ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa yin na 'dir de kho na nyid gang yin pa mdor bstan pa ma byas par rjes su dpag pa dang sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang / de kho na bstan pa'i tham lag mang po dag gis bsgrub ci dgos snyam du sems pa rnams la de'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For those who think this way, in order to show the need for that,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi tshul ni de kho na nyid yin yang ngan rtog rnams dad par mi byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gtso che bas de'i phyir de yongs su bzung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /

original: des ni sangs rgyas go 'phang shes rab sgron mas rtogs bya rtogs med tshul //
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas go 'phang shes rab sgron mas rtogs bya rtogs med tshul //
translated: The state of wisdom that is free from conceptualization.

original: tshig blo kun 'das mkha' ltar dri med mi rtogs 'jigs med de thob nas //
analyzed: tshig blo kun 'das mkha' ltar dri med mi rtogs 'jigs med de thob nas //
translated: Having attained that, which is beyond all conceptual thought, stainless like space, fearless,

original: 'jig rten dag la 'ang shes rab sgron snang mun sel myur du byed par shog / ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag la 'ang shes rab sgron snang mun sel myur du byed par shog / ces bya ba smras te /
translated: May I quickly dispel the darkness of the world with the lamp of wisdom.🔽This is the conclusion of the text.

original: shes rab sgron ma zhes bya 'di byas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun dang tshig le'ur byas pa bzhi brgya bzhi bcu dgu pa mdzad pa'i ming ni shes rab ces bya
analyzed: shes rab sgron ma zhes bya 'di byas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun dang tshig le'ur byas pa bzhi brgya bzhi bcu dgu pa mdzad pa'i ming ni shes rab ces bya
translated: The text composed by the master Nagarjuna is called the Lamp of Wisdom.🔽The master Bhavaviveka himself composed a commentary on it called the Subduer of Bad Opinions.

original: slob dpon legs ldan @339b byed nyid kyis de'i rnam par bshad pa lta ba ngan pa zhi bar byed pa nye bar sbyar ba 'di'i ming shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan @339b byed nyid kyis de'i rnam par bshad pa lta ba ngan pa zhi bar byed pa nye bar sbyar ba 'di'i ming shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the name of this text.

original: de bdag gis byas pa ste /
analyzed: de bdag gis byas pa ste /
translated: I have composed it.

original: des ni sbyor ba ston pa dge ba rab dkon gang thob pa //
analyzed: des ni sbyor ba ston pa dge ba rab dkon gang thob pa //
translated: By this, may I obtain the virtue of teaching the application, which is very rare.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba 'di sbyar ba'i sbyor ba las dge ba bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu dkon pa rus sbal zhar ba'i mgrin pa gnya' shing gi mig tu tshud pa'i tshul ltar bdag gi 'byor pa dang gzhan
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba 'di sbyar ba'i sbyor ba las dge ba bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu dkon pa rus sbal zhar ba'i mgrin pa gnya' shing gi mig tu tshud pa'i tshul ltar bdag gi 'byor pa dang gzhan
translated: It is as rare as a blind turtle rising to the surface of the ocean to find its head inside a yoke floating upon the water.🔽The wealth of self and the wealth of others are extremely rare.

original: gyi 'byor pa rab tu dkon pas bsgrubs pa rgya chen po gang dag tha snyad du sgrub pa'i mchod pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: gyi 'byor pa rab tu dkon pas bsgrubs pa rgya chen po gang dag tha snyad du sgrub pa'i mchod pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: Having first made vast offerings of conventional accomplishment,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i de kho na'i tshul rnam par dbye ba byas pa'i thabs kyi stobs dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i de kho na'i tshul rnam par dbye ba byas pa'i thabs kyi stobs dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba sngon du btang ste /
translated: having first applied the power of method, the way of the suchness of conventional truth, and the application of proper mental attention,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i de kho na'i tshul rtogs par byas pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis thob pa ste des ni dngos bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i de kho na'i tshul rtogs par byas pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis thob pa ste des ni dngos bstan to //
translated: having realized the way of the suchness of ultimate truth, one attains the power of wisdom.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyor ba dang bcas dngos dang bcas pa'i dge ba rab tu dkon pa gang thob pa des te des ni mjug bstan to //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyor ba dang bcas dngos dang bcas pa'i dge ba rab tu dkon pa gang thob pa des te des ni mjug bstan to //
translated: By that means, by that which is obtained, by that which is the means and the essence of the virtue that is difficult to obtain, by that means, the conclusion is shown.

original: de ltar re zhig dge ba bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu dkon pa thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis thob pa rgya chen po sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug bcas pa gang thob pa des ni 'bras bu bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dge ba bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu dkon pa thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis thob pa rgya chen po sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug bcas pa gang thob pa des ni 'bras bu bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos
translated: Thus, by that which is obtained, by the means and the essence of the virtue that is difficult to obtain, the accumulation of merit and wisdom, the extensive means and wisdom, the means and the essence and the conclusion, by that means, the result is shown.🔽The result is the ripening of one's own qualities of a Buddha and the ripening of external sentient beings.

original: yongs su smin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to ;
analyzed: yongs su smin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to ;
translated: The perfection of the cause of the means has been explained.

original: / da ni thabs kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa de'i thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba gnyis bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: / da ni thabs kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa de'i thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba gnyis bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the two results that arise from the means, the ripening of one's own qualities of a Buddha and the ripening of external sentient beings, should be explained.

original: de la re zhig bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob par shog ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob par shog ces bya ba smras te /
translated: To that end, in order to demonstrate the result of the maturation of the Buddha qualities in oneself, he says, “May I attain the state of Buddhahood.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: The state of Buddhahood is the ground of Buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'bras bu'i gnas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'bras bu'i gnas te /
translated: The state of Buddhahood is the ground of the result.

original: de yang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: And that is distinguished by the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the perfection of abandonment, he says,

original: shes rab sgron mas rtogs bya rtogs med tshul //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shes rab sgron mas rtogs bya rtogs med tshul // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The object of realization is the non-realizing mode.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa gtan spangs pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa gtan spangs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is the complete abandonment of all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their propensities.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: As it says in the noble Buddha-bhumi Sutra:

original: chos rnams kun @340a * //🔽gyi de bzhin nyid //🔽sgrib gnyis dag pa'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: chos rnams kun @340a * // gyi de bzhin nyid // sgrib gnyis dag pa'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The reality of all phenomena

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Is characterized by the purification of the two obscurations.

original: de ni shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa med pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa med pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is to be realized by this so-called Lamp of Wisdom in a manner free from conceptual elaboration.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the perfection of wisdom, he says:

original: tshig blo kun 'das zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshig blo kun 'das zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The word is beyond all intellect.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is distinguished by the transformation of the basis, which is the mirror-like wisdom, the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual realization, and the wisdom of accomplishing tasks.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Buddha-field Sutra:

original: dngos po shes pa de la dmigs //
analyzed: dngos po shes pa de la dmigs //
translated: The knowledge of things is focused on that.

original: dbang zad mi shes mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbang zad mi shes mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of inexhaustible power

original: de bzhin nyid shes thams cad du //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shes thams cad du //
translated: The knowledge of reality is in all things.

original: bsgoms pa las ni ye shes 'byung //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las ni ye shes 'byung //
translated: Wisdom arises from meditation.

original: sems can kun la rnam kun du //
analyzed: sems can kun la rnam kun du //
translated: The two kinds of creation for all beings in all ways

original: gnyis bskyed 'bras bu zad mi shes //
analyzed: gnyis bskyed 'bras bu zad mi shes //
translated: are the result of the exhaustion of ignorance.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa //
translated: The emanations of body, speech, and mind

original: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can te //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can te //
translated: have the function of the means of application.🔽The doors of concentration and retention

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sgo dang // dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sgo dang // dpag tu med pa gnyis dang ldan // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: are endowed with the two kinds of inexhaustibility.

original: de ni tshig dang blo kun las 'das pa ste spros pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshig dang blo kun las 'das pa ste spros pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is beyond all words and thoughts, because it is utterly beyond the domain of conceptual elaboration and discursive thought.

original: de ltar spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu de yang sku gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu de yang sku gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: This result, which is distinguished by the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of intuition, is also the essence of the three bodies.

original: chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: They are the body of Dharma, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate those,

original: mkha' ltar dri med mi rtog 'jigs med ces bya ba dag smras te /
analyzed: mkha' ltar dri med mi rtog 'jigs med ces bya ba dag smras te /
translated: he says, “stainless like space, nonconceptual, fearless,”

original: sku gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sku gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: which should be connected respectively with the three bodies.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu bye ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nyid dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu bye ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nyid dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The Dharma body is the pure expanse of reality, distinguished by the perfection of elimination, and the mirror-like pristine awareness, distinguished by the perfection of intuitive wisdom, which is the essence of the transformation of the basis.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyi sku nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ngo bo nyid rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyi sku nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa ngo bo nyid rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the naturally present body, like space, without stains, and is the essence of permanence.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / stobs bcu'i ngo bo nyid kyi mkhyen pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / stobs bcu'i ngo bo nyid kyi mkhyen pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The beatific body is the coalescence of the pristine awareness of the reality of the equal status, which is the result of the cultivation of the ten stages, and the pristine awareness of discernment, which is the essence of the ten powers.

original: de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku mi rtog par thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'gyur bar rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku mi rtog par thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'gyur bar rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the body of Vairocana, omniscience without discursive thought, and is the essence of unchanging permanence.

original: sprul pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa'i bdag nyid bya ba grub pa'i ye shes yin te de ni bdag dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan @340b dang 'brel pa dang / gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i sku 'jigs pa med par sems can gyi don mdzad pa rgyun rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa'i bdag nyid bya ba grub pa'i ye shes yin te de ni bdag dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan @340b dang 'brel pa dang / gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i sku 'jigs pa med par sems can gyi don mdzad pa rgyun rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: The emanation body is the nature of the emanation of speech and mind, which is the gnosis of successful activities. It is the continuous performance of the benefit of sentient beings without fear, through the bodies that are related to oneself, related to others, and related to both.

original: sku gsum yang ji skad du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sku gsum yang ji skad du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: The three bodies are as it is said in the noble Buddha-bhumi Sutra:

original: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sprul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug /'di ni sangs rgyas rnam dag gi / chos dbyings rnam par dag pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sprul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug /'di ni sangs rgyas rnam dag gi / chos dbyings rnam par dag pa yin // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The natural, the perfect enjoyment of Dharma, and the emanation, are engaged in separately. This is the pure Dharma realm of the Buddhas.

original: de dag ni nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa dang / mi rtog pa dang 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa dang / mi rtog pa dang 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: These are stainless like space, non-conceptual, and fearless.

original: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang de thob par shog shig ces bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu thob par bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa yin
analyzed: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang de thob par shog shig ces bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu thob par bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa yin
translated: The way of dedicating by saying, “May I attain such a buddhahood” is the way of dedicating the result of ripening the qualities of a buddha by means of the purity of the three spheres.

original: no // da ni phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: no // da ni phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the result of ripening external sentient beings,

original: de thob nas /🔽'jig rten dag la'ang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de thob nas / 'jig rten dag la'ang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “Having attained that,🔽may I also quickly cause the world to attain it.”

original: de ltar bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang de thob nas 'jig rten dag la'ang myur du de thob par byed par shog shig ces bsngo ba'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang de thob nas 'jig rten dag la'ang myur du de thob par byed par shog shig ces bsngo ba'i tshul bstan to //
translated: Having attained that buddhahood myself, may I also quickly cause the world to attain it.

original: 'jig rten dag la'ang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin pas 'jig rten thams cad la yang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i skal pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du yod par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten dag la'ang zhes spyir smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag la'ang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin pas 'jig rten thams cad la yang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i skal pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du yod par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten dag la'ang zhes spyir smos so //
translated: And in the world means that all sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata, and in order to show that all worlds have the fortune to obtain the fruit of perfect abandonment and perfect wisdom according to the conditions, it is said in general and in the world.

original: phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin pa yang sred pa dang / longs spyod tsam gyi don la ma yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i sku gsum nyid la yongs su smin par bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽shes rab sgron snang mun sel ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin pa yang sred pa dang / longs spyod tsam gyi don la ma yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i sku gsum nyid la yongs su smin par bya bar bstan pa'i phyir / shes rab sgron snang mun sel ces bya ba smras te /
translated: The external ripening of sentient beings is not for the sake of mere craving and enjoyment, but in order to show that they are to be ripened in the three bodies which are distinguished by perfect abandonment and perfect wisdom, the state of Buddhahood,🔽it is said:🔽The Lamp of Wisdom, the Dispeller of Darkness.

original: shes rab sgron snang zhes bya ba ni sngar //
analyzed: shes rab sgron snang zhes bya ba ni sngar //
translated: The Lamp of Wisdom is as follows.

original: shes rab sgron mas rtogs bya rtogs med tshul //🔽zhes smos pa nyid mtshon te /
analyzed: shes rab sgron mas rtogs bya rtogs med tshul // zhes smos pa nyid mtshon te /
translated: The Prajñāpradīpa states, “The object of realization is the mode of non-realization.”

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates that the abandonment of the two obscurations is taught.

original: mun sel ces bya ba ni sngar tshig blo kun 'das zhes smos pa nyid mtshon te /
analyzed: mun sel ces bya ba ni sngar tshig blo kun 'das zhes smos pa nyid mtshon te /
translated: The phrase “dispelling the darkness” indicates that the wisdom that transcends the intellect is taught.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates that the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: de gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu sku gsum myur du thob par byed par shog shig ces bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /🔽myur du byed par shog ces bya ba smras te /🔽des ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu @341a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu sku gsum myur du thob par byed par shog shig ces bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir / myur du byed par shog ces bya ba smras te / des ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu @341a * //
translated: In order to indicate the way of dedicating the merit of composing this text, the author says, “May I quickly attain the three bodies.”🔽This indicates that the result of the text is the attainment of the three bodies of a buddha.

original: 'thob par bsngo ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
